intro: Myrsine pipolyi, commonly known as the Madagascar myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are clustered in small inflorescences and are typically white or pale pink in color. Myrsine pipolyi is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar.
